intro: Calyptranthes polyantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian calyptranthes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release small, winged seeds when mature. Calyptranthes polyantha is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
